questions.question: In what year was N.C. A&T founded?
What is the mascot of N.C. A&T?
What are the official school colors of N.C. A&T?
What is the motto of N.C. A&T (‘Mind and Hand’ in Latin)?
N.C. A&T is located in which city?
N.C. A&T is the largest historically-black university (HBCU) in the U.S. for how many consecutive years?
What is the campus acreage of N.C. A&T’s main site as cited in its Fast Facts?
How many undergraduate degree programs does N.C. A&T offer (approximate, as of the Fast Facts)?
How many doctoral degree programs does N.C. A&T offer (approximate, as of Fast Facts)?
Which of these is *not* a college within N.C. A&T?
Which act led to the establishment of N.C. A&T under the land-grant act for people of color in North Carolina?
What phone number is listed as the main contact for N.C. A&T’s campus?
Which of the following best describes N.C. A&T’s research classification?
N.C. A&T has issued how many patents (approximate) based on its research?
Which of these is a distinguishing achievement: N.C. A&T is the #1 producer of African-American graduates in what fields in North Carolina?
What is the street address of N.C. A&T’s main campus?
Approximately how many alumni does N.C. A&T have (70,000+ as of the website)?
What is the average starting salary within three years of graduation (approximate) for N.C. A&T alumni as reported?
What year did N.C. A&T celebrate its 130th anniversary (given that it was founded in 1891)?
N.C. A&T is accredited as a land-grant institution. What entity generally grants land-grant status in the U.S.?
What is the name of the clock/campanile tower on the N.C. A&T campus named after alumni Willie A. & Carrol C. Deese?
Which campus building or facility is noted for being LEED Silver certified and the university’s first completely green facility?
In Fall 2021-22, what was the total enrollment of N.C. A&T (approximate)?
The nickname of the N.C. A&T athletic teams is the “Aggies.” Which of these fields a team at N.C. A&T?
N.C. A&T is located in which U.S. state?
Which year did the Greensboro sit-in protests involving N.C. A&T students begin?
N.C. A&T operates under what classification (public vs. private)?
What phone area code is used by N.C. A&T’s main campus location?
Which U.S. Department declared N.C. A&T the #1 producer of African-American undergraduates in engineering and agriculture?
Which of these statements is true about N.C. A&T’s student body demographics in a recent year (male vs female)?
What degrees does the CDSE department offer?
Which of the following is listed as a research focus of the CDSE department?
Access to what type of visualization system is offered to CDSE students?
True or False: The CDSE department admits students only with a background in computer science.
How many affiliated faculty from other departments across campus does the CDSE department’s site mention?
Which course is listed as a core course for the MS in Data Science & Engineering program at CDSE?
choises: CSE 620 Introduction to Computational Software Tools
CSE 702 Computational Methods for Algebraic Systems
CSE 805 Machine Learning and Data Mining

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* listed under the 'Other graded CSE Courses' section on the CDSE page?
choises: CSE 817 Fundamentals of Big Data Analysis

questions.question: For the PhD in Computational Data Science & Engineering program, which is one of the four core courses listed?
choises: CSE 708 Data Analytics and Engineering Applications
CSE 802 Computational Methods for Differential Equations

questions.question: Which course is shared in both the MS core list and the 'Other graded CSE Courses' list?
choises: CSE 620 Introduction to Computational Software Tools
CSE 703 Programming for Scalable Computing Systems
CSE 750 Concepts in Computational Data Science & Engineering
CSE 826 Modeling and Simulation of Physical Systems

questions.question: Which course discusses data visualization as indicated by its title in the CDSE course list?
What minimum GPA is required for admission to the MS in Data Science & Engineering program as per CDSE’s site?
Which of these is a course listed under 'Other graded CSE Courses' that focuses on Machine Learning?
choises: CSE 805 Machine Learning and Data Mining
CSE 817 Fundamentals of Big Data Analysis

questions.question: Which of these courses is listed in the PhD core list, according to the CDSE page?
choises: CSE 702 Computational Methods for Algebraic Systems
CSE 708 Data Analytics and Engineering Applications
CSE 750 Concepts in Computational Data Science & Engineering

questions.question: Which category includes 'CSE 799 Continuation of Master’s Thesis' in the CDSE listing?
Which course listed under 'Other graded CSE Courses' appears to involve Modeling & Simulation of Physical Systems?
choises: CSE 816 Concepts in Multi-Scale and Multi-Physics Modeling
CSE 802 Computational Methods for Differential Equations
CSE 750 Concepts in Computational Data Science & Engineering

questions.question: In what year was N.C. A&T founded (as the Agricultural and Mechanical College for the Colored Race)?
At which institution were the first classes of N.C. A&T held?
How many students were in the first session of the college in fall 1891?
In what year did the college move to Greensboro, North Carolina?
What land and cash donation did Greensboro citizens provide for the move?
In what year was the institution first renamed to the Agricultural and Technical College of North Carolina?
In what year did N.C. A&T grant its first bachelor’s degrees?
In what year was the college authorized to begin offering graduate (Master’s) degrees?
Which of these best describes the original admissions policy when the college was founded in 1891?
In what year were female students once again admitted after a period of male-only admission?
What major civil rights action involving N.C. A&T students occurred on February 1, 1960?
choises: Lunch-counter sit-in at a Woolworth’s in Greensboro

questions.question: What informal name is given to the four freshmen from N.C. A&T who sparked the 1960 sit-in?
In what year did the institution change its name to "North Carolina Agricultural and Technical State University"?
In what year did N.C. A&T become a member of the University of North Carolina system?
In what year was the A&T campus’s historic district listed in the U.S. National Register of Historic Places?
What major enrollment milestone did N.C. A&T reach around 2018, making it the largest HBCU in the U.S.?
Which federal legislative act prompted the founding of land-grant institutions for Black students, of which N.C. A&T was one?
Who was the first president of N.C. A&T (then A&M College) elected in 1892?
Under whose presidency did the institution significantly expand academic programs and campus buildings in the 1920s-30s?
In what year did the college add its first doctoral programs (making it a full research institution)?
Which organization’s national science experiment did N.C. A&T’s Cooperative Extension jointly create as the first 1890 institution?
What was the original acreage that Greensboro citizens donated when the campus relocated there?
What was the original cash donation amount from Greensboro citizens for the move to Greensboro?
Which year did the institution change the admissions policy to males only (temporarily)?
Which era of the campus history is associated with 1891-1930 according to the university's official timeline?
Which era of the campus history is associated with 1930–1960 in the university’s timeline?
Which of these buildings is part of the historic district designated in 1988 at N.C. A&T?
Which major civil rights event after 1960 involved N.C. A&T students and the National Guard in Greensboro in May 1969?
Approximately in what year did N.C. A&T receive its largest single-donor gift ($45 million) in its history?
What year did the college achieve designation as a “Regional University” and adopt the name N.C. Agricultural & Technical State University?
